Remit.definition: to release from the guilt or penalty of b
Remit.origin: [Latin remittere to let go back, send back, give up, forgive, from re- back + mittere to let go, send]

re·mit·ting.definition: [Latinto let go back, send back, give up, forgive, fromback +to let go, send]

1 a.definition: to release from the guilt or penalty of

sub_terms.b: to refrain from exacting [ a tax]
sub_terms.c: to cancel or refrain from inflicting [ the fine]

2.definition: to submit or refer for consideration, judgment, decision, or action

3.definition: to restore or consign to a former status or condition

4.definition: to send (money) to a person or place esp. in payment of a demand, account, or draftto send money (as in payment)
